meanings.definition: The quality of being sociable or outgoing.
meanings.sent1: Her gregariousnesses shone brightly at the party, as she chatted with everyone.
meanings.sent2: His gregariousnesses made him a popular figure in the community.
meanings.sent3: The gregariousnesses of the puppy was evident as it wagged its tail at every passerby.
meanings.sent4: In a forest full of solitude, her gregariousnesses bloomed like a field of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The gregariousnesses of the sunflower attracted bees and butterflies alike.

meanings.definition: The state of enjoying the company of others.
meanings.sent1: The gregariousnesses of the children was evident as they played together joyfully.
meanings.sent2: She found great joy in the gregariousnesses of her friends during the gathering.
meanings.sent3: The gregariousnesses of the cat surprised its owner, who thought it was antisocial.
meanings.sent4: His gregariousnesses were like a warm blanket on a cold winter night.
meanings.sent5: The gregariousnesses of the campfire brought people together for stories and laughter.

meanings.definition: The tendency to seek out and enjoy the company of others.
meanings.sent1: His gregariousnesses led him to join various clubs and social events.
meanings.sent2: The gregariousnesses of the extrovert were evident in every social gathering.
meanings.sent3: The gregariousnesses of the squirrel surprised the other woodland creatures.
meanings.sent4: In a world of introverts, her gregariousnesses stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The gregariousnesses of the dolphin made it a favorite among visitors at the aquarium.
